content: child s self-striping hat sport to dk weight self-striping yarn 50 grams - approx 110 yards gauge - 5 st / inch pattern revised and updated may 6 2020 size childʼs xs s m l x l or newborn infant toddler child teen yarn 1 or 2 balls adriafil knitcol self-striping yarn 125 m per 50 gm ball gauge 5 st/in needles size 6 us 4mm 16 circular needle or size needed to achieve gauge size 6 double-pointed needles dpns notions tapestry needle and stitch marker choose your needle size based on the recommended gauge of 5 stitches per inch you might need to go up or down a needle size depending on your own tendency to knit tighter or looser than i do optional - choose a smaller needle to knit ribbing for your hat then switch to the main needle size you can also use a solid color yarn for the ribbing and then switch to the self-striping yarn for the rest of the hat add a pom-pom for an extra bit of fun and flair copyright 2008-2020 janet d russell ● w ww twistedyarnstexas com ● ravelry & instagram twistedknitter cast on 88 96 104 112 120 stitches on circular needles prior to joining to knit in the round make sure your stitches arenʼt twisted place a stitch marker to mark the beginning of the round and knit 2 of ribbing knit 2 purl 2 before switching to stockinette stitch knitting every round knit until your hat measures 5 25 5 5 5 5 6 6 from the cast on edge begin crown decreases tip count your stitches before decreasing for the crown to make sure your stitch count matches the original cast-on number crown decreases round 1 k6 k2tog * repeat to end of round round 2 knit round 3 k5 k2tog * round 4 knit round 5 k4 k2tog * round 6 knit round 7 k3 k2tog * round 8 knit round 9 k2 k2tog * round 10 knit round 11 k1 k2tog * round 12 knit round 13 k2tog * cut a 12 length of yarn and thread a tapestry needle weave yarn through the remaining stitches and tug gently to close the opening poke the needle through a nearby stitch to the underside of the hat and weave in ends wash by hand with a gentle rinse-free wool wash and lay flat to dry thank you so much for purchasing this pattern you ve helped support your local yarn shop along with an independent designer in your community please check out all the ideas and helpful notes on my p attern page on ravelry janet russell https //www ravelry com/people/twistedknitter copyright 2008-2020 janet d russell ● w ww twistedyarnstexas com ● ravelry & instagram twistedknitter
